Welcome to NeoCode, a program created by Fundación dos in collaboration with the National University of Engineering (UNI). Inspired by the 'NeoCode' course at the University of Cambridge, our goal is to provide an introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming.

At NeoCode, we believe that mastering the code is the key to conquering the world. We strive to provide a dynamic and enriching educational environment where students can explore the fundamentals of computer science and develop essential programming skills.
With our tagline 'Master the Code, Conquer the World', we aim to empower individuals to harness the power of technology and create a better future.
Join us on the exciting journey of discovery and learning in the world of computer science. Welcome to NeoCode, where mastering the code is the first step to conquering the world!

What is NeoCode? NeoCode is a program by Fundación dos in collaboration with the National University of Engineering (UNI), based on the NeoCode course from Cambridge University, titled 'Introduction to the intellectual enterprises of computer science and the art of programming.'

How do I access the course? To enroll in this course, you have to visit our installations or contact us for more info. The course includes virtual sessions that you can attend from home or any location with internet access, as well as in-person sessions with laboratory practices, tutors, and plenty of fun. The in-person sessions take place at the National University of Engineering in Managua, with flexible scheduling, or remotely via virtual attendance.

What do I need? The course is free of charge for you; however, we require regular attendance at lectures, virtual sessions, and other in-person activities. To successfully complete the course, approximately 14 hours per week are needed, including time for in-person sessions, virtual attendance, study hours, and work at home. It is preferable to have a computer with internet access and to submit assignments or PSets promptly. With dedication and effort, we are confident you can succeed.

patterns: What is the duration of the course?
How many weeks is the course?
responses: The NeoCode course runs for 12 weeks, covering a comprehensive range of topics in computer science and programming.

patterns: What is the cost of the course?
How much does the course cost?
responses: The NeoCode course is free of charge for all participants.

patterns: What are the requirements for the course?
Do I need any prior knowledge?
Do I need experience to join the course?
responses: No prior knowledge is required to join the NeoCode course. It is designed for beginners and those new to computer science and programming.
The NeoCode course includes both virtual and in-person sessions. The schedule is flexible, with multiple options available for in-person sessions at the National University of Engineering in Managua.

patterns: How do I get in touch?
responses: You can contact us through our website or visit our installations at the National University of Engineering in Managua. You can also reach us via email at contact@neocode.com.

patterns: What will I learn in the course?
What kind of projects will I work on?
What benefits does the course offer?
How can this course help me?
responses: You will gain a broad and robust understanding of computer science and programming.
You will learn how to think algorithmically and solve programming problems efficiently.
You will cover concepts like abstraction, algorithms, data structures, encapsulation, resource management, security, software engineering, and web development.
You will become familiar with a number of languages, including C, Python, SQL, and JavaScript plus CSS and HTML.
You will engage with a vibrant community of like-minded learners from all levels of experience.
You will develop and present a final programming project to your peers.
